intro: Willdenowia humilis, commonly known as the dwarf willdenowia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Willdenowia humilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
